name: The Eastleigh

reviews.text: upon arrival we was met by Claire's brother who was very welcoming and showed us to our room and our breakfast table.
reviews.title: Fantasitc! Claire & Gary are wonderful. (Family suite room 3)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was clean and very nicely decorated prefect for us as a young couple and a small child, there is an honesty bar in the room which is well stocked with different drinks and also a bar down stairs in the lounge,
reviews.title: Lovely hotel & good location :-)
Beware their website
reviews.text: There is plenty of tea and coffee im the room and if you ran out there was always spare down stairs,
Beds were very comfortable and quite at night so had a great nights sleep.
reviews.title: A warm, friendly and inviting place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From our room you could see the sea so that was nice.
reviews.title: we were made to feel very welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I could not disagree with the previous review more,they must have stayed in a different hotel to us because Gary and Claire did everything they could to make ours a pleasant stay.Right from the start of our three night break nothing was too much trouble for them,tea was brought up to our room on arrival,even the luggage was carried up to our room for us and we got a parking space in their own pivate car park.We stayed in room 8,the luxury room with the sea view and four poster bed and found it to be lovely and clean,we were even given the option of having breakfast in bed if we wanted to.The room was cleaned everyday,with ample suppplies of tea and coffee,that could be replenished anytime.Breakfast was nice,no problems at all and the location is just perfect.My wife can be picky so i know if there had have been a problem with cleanliness etc they would have been told about it.All in all a lovely hotel and great location and Gary and Claire were very nice .Would definately come back here,so dont know what the previous review is all about,we found it perfect,thanks again,Steve and Cheryl,who stayed with you for 3 nights from August 9th.
reviews.title: "Lovely hotel and location"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Gary and Claire are welcoming right from the start, food lovely and freshly cooked, rooms very clean, location very good about 1 minute walk to Skegness Pier. Will definately recommend to family and friends. Thankyou for a nice stay.
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.text: I stay second time that hotel this time 4 nights and wouldn"t hestitate to go again.Ideal location .Very warm welcome from Claire &Gary.Evrything was extremely clean and very welcoming.The breakfast was delicious.The room was decorated to a high standard.Thanks very much for great time and see you soon xxx
reviews.title: Highly recommended excellent service and food :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here from 6th to 8th June 2011, we were on a tour around the east coast. We stayed in the King size luxury room, sea view, room 3. The sea view was not obvious as you had to look out the window to your right and down the street, so it was a bit naughty to call it a sea view.
reviews.title: 10/10 value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room had just been renovated and was clean and tidy, the bathroom was very small and difficult to move around in. There were loads of lovely touches like creams and lotions over and above the usual for a small B&B like this. There was also a small fridge in the room which was a nice touch however it was rather noisy during the night.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great location (Agata & Ziggy room 10)

reviews.text: i stayed here for 2 nights was on business . i was meet by gary he showed me all arond the hotel then offered me a pot of tea how nice..the best thing was they did a early breckfast for business guest 7 am if you need it ... and the also have free wifi in the rooms..when it came to going sleep the eastleig are very big on noise there are sighhs all over thhe hotel with quite please and it was just tat the room was well done up and agreat breckfast to will stay there again when i work in skegness
reviews.title: great place will be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed a very nice holiday at Skegness and were pleased to have stayed at the Eastleigh. The location was excellent, just by the pier and within easy walking distance of shops, resturants and bars.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a suite which was on the small size but had lots of nice touches ie: plenty of tea/coffee etc, bathrobes, hairdrier, hair tongs as well as creams and lotions for pampering. The breakfast was cooked nicely, hot and tasty with plenty of choice, you have to put in your requirements the day before which was not a problem, breakfast was always ready and waiting.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended - One of the best Guest Accommodations to stay at.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The car park at the rear was small but having a luxury room we were guaranteed a parking space, otherwise there is free parking on the street (at non busy times)
reviews.title: Great Little Find, will definately visit again

reviews.text: The Eastleigh hotel had all you need for an excellent Bed and Breakfast by the seaside.
reviews.title: a place we will return to!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Coming from Nottingham, our holidays were always on the East Coast so I still retained images of what it was like forty years ago. Staying at the Eastleigh completely turned those images on their head. Excellent location, friendly and efficient; scrupulously clean and well equipped; extensive and well cooked breakfast. You couldn't ask for more and nothing was too much trouble. While there we discovered 'Bon Appetite' around the corner on Rutland Street; a sandwich and patisserie place: excellent, reasonably-priced stuff and their chocolate cakes...!
reviews.title: Excellent B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Eastleigh from the 25/10 - 29/10/2011 for our honeymoon. We stayed in room 8 and the views from there were lovely. The room was very clean, as was the rest of the hotel, and a comfortable bed, so we slept really well. We arrived to a friendly greeting and were shown around. As it was our honeymoon we were even given a complimentary bottle of wine. If there was anything we needed, all we had to do was ask. The hotel itself is only round the corner from the pier, and we were surprised how quiet it was. Breakfast was served every morning to a high standard, and the staff that served it were always friendly and were lovely to chat to. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, and looking forward to taking some friends and family there next year, and hopefully next time, we stay, my husband will not be full of cold, which was the only bad thing about it!
reviews.title: Many Thanks to Garry, Claire and their Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Many thanks again to Garry, Claire and their staff for making us feel so welcome! It truly was home away from home!
reviews.title: relaxing enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: on arrival we were told we had been up graded which was a nice surprise, we had secure parking behind the hotel, the hotel was near the shops, cafe's and amusements but was surprisingly quiet, our room was at the back of the hotel there was very little noise, the room had everything that you could need, there was even some toiletries, there was ample tea and coffee which were replenished daily, you had to fill in the form to say what you required for breakfast the following morning which was a good idea as it was ready for you when you came down in the morning,the hosts claire and gary did everything to make our stay as good as they could, really enjoyed a relaxing time in skegness, will return again.
reviews.title: Nice B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely B&B....The hosts were perfect....nothing was too much trouble. We had a luxery room, which was fine.The breakfast was excellent.Overall, a great experience.
reviews.title: Very good - Would stay again.

description: The Eastleigh has an enviable location, conveniently close to the seafront, Skegness Pier and North Parade, and an easy walk to the beach, the centre of town, the bowling greens and Embassy Theatre. All rooms are comfortably furnished, well-appointed doubles arranged over three floors and all are en-suite with power showers. Rooms at the front have a limited sea-view, and all other rooms face the rear of the property. Many unexpected little extras make a stay at The Eastleigh a little more special. The Eastleigh is 'room-only' and does not offer any meals, which is reflected in the attractive room rates. Allocated parking in the private car park is available for some rooms, otherwise there is ample on-street unlimited free parking.
